Package net.royalur.model

Class PlayerState

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.royalur.model.PlayerState
  • public class PlayerState
extends java.lang.Object
    A player state represents the state of a single player at a point in the game. This includes the player's score and number of pieces left to play.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      int pieceCount
      The number of pieces that the player has yet to play.
      Player player
      The player that this state represents.
      int score
      The number of pieces that the player has taken off the board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PlayerState​(Player player, int pieceCount, int score)
      Instantiates a state for a player in a game.

      Generates a copy of this player state with a single piece added to this player.

      Creates a copy of this player state with a new piece count and score.

      S      		 safeCopy​(S original, java.util.function.Function<S,​PlayerState> copyFn)
      Copies the player state original using the provided copy function, and verifies that the copied player state is of the same type as the original.
      PlayerState scorePiece()
      Generates a copy of this player state with a single piece added to the score of this player.

      Generates a copy of this player state with a single piece subtracted from this player.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        @Nonnull
public PlayerState copy​(int newPieceCount,
                        int newScore)
        Creates a copy of this player state with a new piece count and score.
        Parameters:
        newPieceCount - The new piece count for the copied player state.
        newScore - The new score for the copied player state.
        Returns:
        A copy of this player state with updated piece count and score.

      • safeCopy

        @Nonnull
public static <S extends PlayerState> S safeCopy​(@Nonnull
                                                 S original,
                                                 @Nonnull
                                                 java.util.function.Function<S,​PlayerState> copyFn)
        Copies the player state original using the provided copy function, and verifies that the copied player state is of the same type as the original. This is used to increase type safety when custom PlayerState subclasses are created.
        Type Parameters:
        S - The type of the player state that has been copied.
        Parameters:
        original - The player state that has been copied.
        copyFn - A function to copy the original player state.
        Returns:
        A copy of the player state state.
